title: About Hmong Culture
subtitle: Discover the Rich Heritage of the Hmong People

hero.description: Explore the vibrant traditions, deep-rooted customs, and timeless wisdom of Hmong communities around the world. From ancient ceremonies to daily village life, experience the beauty of a culture that has preserved its identity across generations.

newYear.title: Hmong New Year - Noj Peb Caug
newYear.subtitle: A Celebration of Renewal and Unity
newYear.description: The Hmong New Year, celebrated annually, is the most significant cultural festival marking the end of the harvest season and the beginning of a new year. It is a time for honor, spirit, and community bonding.
traditions: Traditional ball tossing (pov pob) between young men and women
Colorful traditional clothing with intricate embroidery
Honoring ancestors and seeking blessings for the new year
newYear.duration: Celebrated for 3-7 days, typically in November or December

farming.title: Traditional Farming & Agriculture
farming.subtitle: Living in Harmony with the Land
farming.description: Agriculture has been the cornerstone of Hmong life for centuries. Hmong farmers have developed sustainable farming practices adapted to mountainous regions, growing rice, corn, vegetables, and herbs.
practices: Rice cultivation on terraced mountain fields
Sustainable farming techniques passed down through generations
Growing traditional vegetables and medicinal herbs
Animal husbandry including poultry, pigs, and water buffalo
Preserving seeds for future planting seasons
farming.philosophy: Work with nature, respect the land, and share the harvest

wedding.title: Wedding Ceremonies
wedding.subtitle: Sacred Union of Two Souls
wedding.description: Hmong weddings are elaborate multi-day celebrations filled with meaningful rituals, symbolic exchanges, and community participation. The ceremony binds not just two individuals, but two families together.
traditions: Bride's departure ceremony from her family home
Wedding feast with traditional foods and music
Exchange of gifts and blessings between families
The groom's journey to bring the bride to his home
wedding.symbolism: Weddings symbolize the union of lineages and the continuation of Hmong traditions

villageLife.title: Village Life & Childhood
villageLife.subtitle: Growing Up in Community
villageLife.description: Hmong villages are close-knit communities where children grow up surrounded by extended family, learning traditions, language, and values through daily life and play.
activities: Children playing traditional games in village squares
Learning traditional crafts and skills from elders
Helping with family chores and farming
Storytelling sessions that preserve oral history
villageLife.values: Respect, community cooperation, and preservation of cultural identity

values.title: Core Hmong Values
values.subtitle: Principles That Guide Our Way of Life

items.title: Family First
items.description: Family is the center of Hmong society, with strong emphasis on respecting elders and caring for children

items.title: Community Unity
items.description: Collective well-being and mutual support are essential for community prosperity

items.title: Cultural Preservation
items.description: Passing down traditions, language, and customs to future generations

items.title: Harmony with Nature
items.description: Living sustainably and respecting the natural environment
